articles.headline: With Steve Wynn Gone, ‘Queen of Las Vegas’ Does Boardroom Battle
articles.snippet: Elaine Wynn, the casino and resort company’s largest shareholder and Mr. Wynn’s ex-wife, is fighting to oust a longtime board member who is close to Mr. Wynn.
articles.abstract: Elaine Wynn, the casino and resort company’s largest shareholder and Mr. Wynn’s ex-wife, is fighting to oust a longtime board member who is close to Mr. Wynn.
articles.lead_paragraph: Elaine Wynn, known as the Queen of Las Vegas for her long involvement with Mirage and Wynn Resorts, the casino and resort companies she founded with her ex-husband Steve Wynn, might seem an unlikely champion of shareholder rights and good corporate governance.

articles.headline: Kirstjen Nielsen, Chief of Homeland Security, Almost Resigned After Trump Tirade
articles.snippet: The president, angry about an increase in illegal immigration, dressed down Kirstjen Nielsen in front of the entire cabinet during a meeting on Wednesday.
articles.abstract: The president, angry about an increase in illegal immigration, dressed down Kirstjen Nielsen in front of the entire cabinet during a meeting on Wednesday.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Kirstjen Nielsen, the homeland security secretary, told colleagues she was close to resigning after President Trump berated her on Wednesday in front of the entire cabinet for what he said was her failure to adequately secure the nation’s borders, according to several current and former officials familiar with the episode.
articles.byline: By Michael D. Shear and Nicole Perlroth

articles.headline: U.S. Takes a Risk: Old Iraqi Enemies Are Now Allies
articles.snippet: In Iraq, the United States is training and sharing intelligence with former members of Iranian-backed militias that once fought and killed Americans.
articles.abstract: In Iraq, the United States is training and sharing intelligence with former members of Iranian-backed militias that once fought and killed Americans.
articles.lead_paragraph: MOSUL, Iraq — Iraq’s interior minister, Qassim al-Araji, has a troubled history with the United States. He was detained twice by the Americans at the notorious Camp Bucca prison during the Iraq war and held for 23 months, accused of smuggling Iranian-made bombs that had become effective killers of American troops.

articles.headline: AT&T Chief Says It Made a ‘Big Mistake’ Hiring Michael Cohen
articles.snippet: In a companywide memo, Randall Stephenson also said the company’s head of lobbying would retire.
articles.abstract: In a companywide memo, Randall Stephenson also said the company’s head of lobbying would retire.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Randall L. Stephenson, AT&T’s chief executive, said on Friday that the company had made a “big mistake” by hiring President Trump’s personal lawyer, Michael D. Cohen, to provide advice on federal policy, including how the government might approach the telecommunications giant’s deal to buy Time Warner.
articles.byline: By Cecilia Kang and Kenneth P. Vogel

articles.headline: On U.S.-North Korea Talks, China May Hold the Cards
articles.snippet: President Trump wants to maintain sanctions until the North disarms. But on the ground, China’s more phased approach is already carrying the day.
articles.abstract: President Trump wants to maintain sanctions until the North disarms. But on the ground, China’s more phased approach is already carrying the day.
articles.lead_paragraph: DANDONG, China — Along the Chinese border with North Korea, the evidence of Beijing’s leverage in the coming talks between President Trump and the North Korean leader, Kim Jong-un, is everywhere.

articles.headline: Quilts, Cows, Money and Meaning: College Essays That Stood Out
articles.snippet: This year, we picked five college application essays about money to publish. College admissions officers admired their maturity, self-awareness and humanity.
articles.abstract: This year, we picked five college application essays about money to publish. College admissions officers admired their maturity, self-awareness and humanity.
articles.lead_paragraph: In all my years of studying up on taxes, I’d never read — or knew I wanted to read — an essay about how filling out Form 1040 can teach profound lessons about the enduring power of the human spirit.
